lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/prts.Prts.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run prts.Prts.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* Signals that the save file had failed to load, and so a new save had to be created.
super("File failed to load, created new save file.");
* Signals that the save file failed to load, and furthermore, that PRTS attempted to create a new
super("Failed to load save file, new save file could not be created.");
* Signals that the input value is out of range of the list.
super("Please provide a number within range.");
* A chatbot and to-do list that can receive text input from the user, parse it, and execute
* Constructs a PRTS object, and initializes its fields.
* Starts the main program loop of PRTS.
* A general exception for any errors that PRTS may encounter in its execution. All other custom
* exceptions in PRTS extend from this class.
* @param message The error message to be displayed.
* Signals that an error occurred attempting to save the state of the TaskList to the save file.
super("Failed to save to save file.");
* The class responsible for dealing with saving and loading the state of the TaskList to and from
* a save file on the user's hard disk.
* Constructs a Storage object. In addition, verifies if the specified file path for the save file
* exists. If it does not exist, creates the necessary directory/directories and file.
* @param fileName The name of the desired save file.
* @param directories One or more desired directory names, to specify the path where the file
*                    should be stored in. These extend off of <code>System.getProperty(user.dir)
System.out.println("Save file could not be located, new file created");
* Attempts to load the TaskList from the save file.
* @throws CreateNewSaveException If the file could not be located or read, and a new save file
* @throws NewSaveFailedException If the file could not be located or read, and a new save file
public TaskList load() throws CreateNewSaveException, NewSaveFailedException {
* Attempts to save the TaskList to the save file.
* @throws SaveToFileException If the TaskList could not be successfully saved to the file.
public void save(TaskList tasks) throws SaveToFileException {
* Represents the list of Tasks the user has added in PRTS, and manages all modifications to this list.
* Adds a new Task to the list.
* @param task The Task to be added to the list.
* @return A message to be displayed to the user as acknowledgement and indication of successful
* Deletes a Task from the list.
* @param index The index of the Task to be deleted from the list.

* @return A message to be displayed to the user as acknowledgement and indication of successful
* @throws OutOfRangeException If the index provided is 0 or less, or greater than the size of
public String delete(Integer index) throws OutOfRangeException {
return "Your task list has been cleared.";
builder.append("As you wish. This task has been removed:\n");
* Marks an item in the list as done.
* @param index The index of the Task in the list to be marked.
*              This is a number from 1 to the size of the list, or null if all items should be
* @return A message to be displayed to the user as acknowledgement and indication of successful
* @throws OutOfRangeException If the index provided is 0 or less, or greater than the size of
* @throws AlreadyMarkedException If the item to be marked is already marked.
public String mark(Integer index) throws OutOfRangeException, AlreadyMarkedException {

* @throws OutOfRangeException If the index provided is 0 or less, or greater than the size of
* @throws AlreadyUnmarkedException If the item to be unmarked is already unmarked.
public String unmark(Integer index) throws OutOfRangeException, AlreadyUnmarkedException {
return "Uncharacteristic of you. More work has been added to the pile.\n" + task.toString();
* Returns a message depending on whether the list is empty. For personality only.
return "There's still lots of work that needs to be done. " +
"We can't afford to have you resting.";
* Returns the number of items in the list.
* @return The number of items in the list.
* Returns a string representation of the task list.
* @return the string representation of the task list.
return "...\n" + "You don't have any tasks. Enjoy your day off.";
* Searches through the list for all tasks containing the given string.
* @param searchTerm The term(s) to search for.
* @return A list of the tasks that contain the search term.
* The class responsible for all interaction with the user. User input and almost all program
* output is managed by this class.
private final Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
* Displays the initial message on startup.
"\n...Fingerprint match found. Verification complete. Welcome home.\n" +
"PRTS, at your service. What would you like to do today?\n" + hardbreak);
* Displays the farewell message upon exiting the program.
System.out.println("Farewell. See you again soon.\n" + hardbreak);
* Reads in the next line of user input.
* @return The raw user input, as a string.
* Lists the current Tasks stored in the TaskList.
* @param tasks The current state of the TaskList.
System.out.println("Here are your tasks for today.");
System.out.println("You now have " + tasks.getSize() + " tasks in your list.");
* Displays a given message to the user.
* @param message The message to be displayed.
* The general command used for adding a Task to the TaskList.
* This Task can be any of the Task types.
* Constructs the AddCommand object with the Task to be added to the list.
* @param task The task to be added.
* Executes the addition of the Task to the TaskList.
* @param tasks The list of tasks currently stored.
* @param ui The UI object stored by PRTS.
* @param storage The Storage object stored by PRTS.
* @throws SaveToFileException If the Storage object fails to save the state of the TaskList
* after the addition of the Task.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws SaveToFileException {
* Represents a general command that the user has input to PRTS.
* Executes the command given by the user.
* @param tasks The list of tasks currently stored.
* @param ui The UI object stored by PRTS.
* @param storage The Storage object stored by PRTS.
* @throws SaveToFileException If the program fails to save the state of the TaskList to the save
* file after the execution of TaskList-modifying commands.
* @throws OutOfRangeException If the execution encounters user input that falls outside valid ranges.
* @throws AlreadyMarkedException If the Task being marked is already marked.
* @throws AlreadyUnmarkedException If the Task being unmarked is already unmarked.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws SaveToFileException,
* Returns true if the user command is to exit the program, and false otherwise.
* @return true if this command is an ExitCommand, and false otherwise.
* The parser used to convert arbitrary user input into definite commands executable by PRTS.
* Specific keywords are required to signal to the CommandParser what command is input, and they must be
* the first word input in the line.
* Parses the user input, returning a Command.
* Recognizes predefined keywords if they occur at the start of the user input.
* Certain commands must follow predefined syntax to be parsed correctly.
* Whitespace is stripped and will not affect parsing.
* @param fullCommand The raw user input received from the UI.
* @return A Command that can be executed by PRTS.
* @throws ParsingException If an error is encountered when parsing user input.
public static Command parse(String fullCommand) throws ParsingException {
System.out.println("Roger that. Preparations will be underway.");

return new AddCommand(new Event(eventDescription, startDate, endDate));
return new MessageCommand("Sorry, I didn't quite catch that. Are you having enough sleep?");
* The command for deletion of a Task from the TaskList.

public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws SaveToFileException, OutOfRangeException {

public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {}
* Returns true to signal that the program should exit.

* Constructs a FindCommmand objet with the given search term.
* The search term is copied verbatim from the user input.
* Does not search for dates if the date is parsed into a Date.
* @param searchTerm The term to search for.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws SaveToFileException,

* @param ui The UI object stored by PRTS.
* @param storage The Storage object stored by PRTS.

* @throws SaveToFileException If the Storage object fails to save the state of the TaskList
* after the marking of the Task.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws OutOfRangeException,
* The general command for simply displaying a given message to the user.
* Constructs a MessageCommand object, given the string to be displayed.
* @param message The message to be displayed.
* Executes the displaying of the message.
* @param tasks The list of tasks currently stored.
* @param ui The UI object stored by PRTS.
* @param storage The Storage object stored by PRTS.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Signals that an error has occurred when parsing the user input.
* This error can be of various types, and a different error message is displayed according to the
* input type of error. A full list of error types is listed in the enum ExceptionType.
* Constructs a ParsingException given the error type.
* @param exceptionType The type of parsing error encountered.
super("There was an error in parsing your input.");
* Returns an error message that changes depending on the type of parsing error this is.
return "I can't read your mind. Do add a description.";
return "I can't read your mind. Do add more details.";
return "I can't read your mind. Provide a suitable index.";
return "Sorry, you're speaking a little fast. Could you repeat just the first word?";
* The command for marking a Task as not yet complete.
* Constructs a UnmarkCommand object, given the index of the task to be deleted.
* @param index The index of the task to be unmarked. If all tasks are to be unmarked,
* Executes the marking of the Task as not yet done.

* @param ui The UI object stored by PRTS.
* @param storage The Storage object stored by PRTS.
* @throws OutOfRangeException If the index provided is out of range of the TaskList.

* @throws SaveToFileException If the Storage object fails to save the state of the TaskList
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws AlreadyUnmarkedException,
* Signals that the user is trying to mark a task that is already marked.
* Is only thrown by the mark() function in the Task object.
* Signals that the user is trying to unmark a task that already isn't marked.
* Is only thrown by the unmark() function in the Task object.
* Represents a deadline with a due date.
* The date can be parsed if input in the form Day-Month-Year, with a short Month form.
* If the date cannot be parsed, stores the user-input string as the due date.
private String addMessage = "Alright. I'll make sure you don't forget it.";
